author: Raúl Díaz
title: ¿Qué pasó en la Álvaro Obregón? Matan a balazos a hombre en Barrio Norte
text: ¿Qué pasó en la alcaldía Álvaro Obregón de la Ciudad de México (CDMX)? La tarde de este jueves 25 de abril, un hombre fue [asesinado a balazos](https://www.sdpnoticias.com/estados/cdmx/que-paso-en-eje-central-hoy-25-de-abril-matan-a-balazos-a-hombre-cerca-de-la-central-de-autobuses-del-norte/) en el Barrio Norte. De acuerdo con lo indicado en reportes, se trató de una agresión armada directa que ocurrió sobre el Andador Díaz Ordaz del Barrio Norte en la alcaldía Álvaro Obregón. Derivado del ataque con arma de fuego, un hombre fue asesinado en el lugar, por lo cual las autoridades de la CDMX realizaron la detención del responsable de los hechos. En el informe actualizado al mes de marzo de 2024 sobre la incidencia delictiva en el país, la CDMX no se ubicó en la lista de las [5 entidades más peligrosas de México](https://www.sdpnoticias.com/mexico/los-5-estados-mas-peligrosos-de-mexico-2024/). Matan a hombre en Barrio Norte, Álvaro Obregón Un ataque armado directo que dejó un muerto, se registró cerca del mediodía de este 25 de abril, en calles de la colonia Barrio Norte de la alcaldía Álvaro Obregón. La información en torno al crimen refiere que la víctima, un hombre llamado Osvaldo de 33 años de edad, se encontraba reparando una motocicleta en el lugar del incidente. [VIDEO: Samuel García no le tiene miedo a dios y pintó su Cybertruck color “fosfo, foso”](/estados/nuevo-leon/video-samuel-garcia-no-le-tiene-miedo-a-dios-y-pinto-su-cybertruck-color-fosfo-foso/) [¿Quién es Miguel Cortés Miranda, el químico y feminicida serial de Iztacalco? Su familia le pidió que confesara; Fiscalía de CDMX confirma 7 víctimas](/estados/cdmx/quien-es-miguel-cortes-miranda-el-quimico-que-seria-responsable-de-varios-feminicidios-en-cdmx/) [Melanie Lattanzi, novia de Fofo Márquez, podría ser acusada de ser cómplice en delito de tentativa de feminicidio](/estados/edomex/melanie-lattanzi-novia-de-fofo-marquez-podria-ser-acusada-de-ser-complice-en-delito-de-tentativa-de-feminicidio/) Sin mediar palabra, un sujeto que portaba una arma de fuego y se aproximó hasta el punto en el que estaba Osvaldo, disparó en su contra en un total de 3 ocasiones. Mediante un seguimiento realizado por el C5 de la CDMX, se identificó que tras perpetrar la agresión, el sujeto se retiró del lugar e ingresó a una casa del mismo Barrio Norte. Detienen a sujeto que mató a hombre en Barrio Norte, en la Álvaro Obregón Por medio de las labores de monitoreo realizado por personal del C5, policías de la Secretaría de Seguridad Ciudadana (SSC) fueron alertados por el ataque a balazos. Debido a ello, elementos se trasladaron hasta el andador Díaz Ordaz en el Barrio Norte de la alcaldía Álvaro Obregón, donde encontraron el cuerpo sin vida de Osvaldo. Tras solicitar el apoyo se los servicios de emergencia y cuerpos de investigación, los policías desplegaron un operativo para detener al responsable del asesinato. El registro tomado por las cámaras de video vigilancia, permitió identificar el inmueble al cual ingresó el atacante, por lo cual los policías se dirigieron a dicho inmueble. Una vez en el domicilio, los elementos de la SSC procedieron a detener al sujeto, quien ya fue trasladado al Ministerio Público donde se definirá su situación jurídica. Hasta el momento no se han emitido mayores detalles sobre el caso, por lo que se desconocen las líneas de investigación que se siguen en torno al ataque armado.

author: FOX 5 DC
title: Americans think DC is the most undesirable city to live, according to new study | FOX 5 DC
text: The Brief The District of Columbia was ranked as the most undesirable city for the second year in a row, according to researchers at Clever Real Estate, who surveyed 1,000 American adults in June to find out the best and worst places to live in 2024 .About 33% of Americans said it was one of the top five worst cities in the U.S. — up from 20% who said the same in 2023.The District is one of the most expensive cities in the country, and 65% of Americans surveyed in the study said that a high cost of living makes a place undesirable.Despite this, another recent study found D.C. the best place for working parents to live. According to the findings, D.C. topped the ranking with high scores in both the work and health categories, with 25% of its workforce being remote and registering 350 pediatricians per 100,000 children. RELATED: Washington DC ranks No. 1 for working parents To gather the data, each respondent answered 25 questions related to where they live, which areas of the U.S. they preferred, and what they believe made a city or state desirable.Migration data from the U.S. Census at the state and metro level was also analyzed to determine which states and cities Americans were moving in and out of.Here’s a look at the best places to live in 2024 , according to the study.The data revealed that the majority of Americans (73%) like where they live, but more than half (59%) said they still get frustrated by their city or state. In fact, 43% of respondents said their state embarrasses them.Americans also said that a low crime rate, low housing and living costs and good weather were the primary factors that make up a desirable place to live. Contrastingly, a high crime rate, high cost of living and high taxes made a place undeisireable.The study also showed that 84% of Americans said they could be convinced to leave their city or state, with an increase in crime being the top reason (58%).When relocating, affordable housing was considered the single most important factor, above safety, low cost of living, and proximity to family and friends. This story was reported from Los Angeles.

author: Yaffee
title: Alabama AG Steve Marshall joins lawsuit to stop Biden from giving free healthcare to illegal aliens - Yellowhammer News
text:
By Yaffee August 8, 2024 Share Facebook Twitter Email (U.S. CBP/Flickr) Alabama Attorney General Steve Marshall is making the legal case that illegal aliens should not be receiving healthcare benefits from the federal government.
Marshall joined a coalition of 16 states in filing a lawsuit to stop the Biden-Harris administration from allowing illegal aliens from receiving the Affordable Care Act (aka Obamacare).
“The latest assault on the American worker by the Biden-Harris administration is forcing tax paying American citizens to subsidize Obamacare for illegal aliens,” Marshall said. “Not only is this unconstitutional, but it is just plain wrong.”
The final plan, set to take effect November 1, would make more than 200,000 deferred actions for childhood arrival (DACA) recipients eligible for taxpayer-subsidized health plans, including 3,460 in Alabama.
DACA is and executive order that was put forward by then President Barack Obama. It is an immigration policy that allows some individuals with unlawful presence in the United States after being brought to the country as children to receive a renewable two-year period of deferred action from deportation and become eligible for a work permit in the U.S.
“First, this administration is demanding that hardworking Americans pay for someone else’s college degree, then it forces them to pay for medical procedures that violate their beliefs, and now they want to dictate paying for healthcare for people who shouldn’t even be in this country,” Marshall said. “At some point the taxpayers are going to run out of money to give the government to fund their ill-conceived entitlement programs.”
Marshall said that the new regulation announced by the Department of Health and Human Services violates the plain text of the Affordable Care Act, or Obamacare, itself.
“In the ACA,” the complaint reads, “Congress limited eligibility to participate in a qualified health plan through a subsidized health exchange to citizens or nationals of the United States and individuals ‘lawfully present’ in the United States.”
According to the complaint, the proposed rule also violates a federal law that prohibits giving public benefits to aliens.
In addition to Attorney General Marshall and Kansas Attorney General Kobach, attorneys general from Idaho, Indiana, Iowa, Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, New Hampshire, North Dakota, Ohio, South Carolina, South Dakota, Tennessee, and Virginia also joined the suit.
Yaffee is a contributing writer to Yellowhammer News and hosts “The Yaffee Program” weekdays 9-11 a.m. on WVNN . You can follow him on X @Yaffee
